org.apache.freemarker.core.templateresolver.impl

Class URLTemplateLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.freemarker.core.templateresolver.impl.URLTemplateLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TemplateLoader
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassTemplateLoader

    public abstract class URLTemplateLoader
extends Object
implements TemplateLoader
    This is an abstract template loader that can load templates whose location can be described by an URL. Subclasses only need to override the getURL(String), extractNegativeResult(URLConnection), and perhaps the prepareConnection(URLConnection) method.

    • Method Detail

      • getURLConnectionUsesCaches

        public Boolean getURLConnectionUsesCaches()
        Getter pair of setURLConnectionUsesCaches(Boolean).

      • setURLConnectionUsesCaches

        public void setURLConnectionUsesCaches(Boolean urlConnectionUsesCaches)
        Sets if URLConnection.setUseCaches(boolean) will be called, and with what value. By default this is false, because FreeMarker has its own template cache with its own update delay setting (Configuration.getTemplateUpdateDelayMilliseconds()). If this is set to null, URLConnection.setUseCaches(boolean) won't be called.

      • createSession

        public TemplateLoaderSession createSession()
        Description copied from interface: TemplateLoader
        Creates a new session, or returns null if the template loader implementation doesn't support sessions. See TemplateLoaderSession for more information about sessions.
        Specified by:
        createSession in interface TemplateLoader

      • load

        public TemplateLoadingResult load(String name,
                                  TemplateLoadingSource ifSourceDiffersFrom,
                                  Serializable ifVersionDiffersFrom,
                                  TemplateLoaderSession session)
                           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: TemplateLoader
        Loads the template content together with meta-data such as the version (usually the last modification time).
        Specified by:
        load in interface TemplateLoader
        Parameters:
        name - The name (template root directory relative path) of the template, already localized and normalized by the cache. It is completely up to the loader implementation to interpret the name, however it should expect to receive hierarchical paths where path components are separated by a slash (not backslash). Backslashes (or any other OS specific separator character) are not considered as separators by FreeMarker, and thus they will not be replaced with slash before passing to this method, so it's up to the template loader to handle them (say, by throwing an exception that tells the user that the path (s)he has entered is invalid, as (s)he must use slash -- typical mistake of Windows users). The passed names are always considered relative to some loader-defined root location (often referred as the "template root directory"), and will never start with a slash, nor will they contain a path component consisting of either a single or a double dot -- these are all resolved by the template cache before passing the name to the loader. As a side effect, paths that trivially reach outside template root directory, such as ../my.ftl, will be rejected by the template cache, so they never reach the template loader. Note again, that if the path uses backslash as path separator instead of slash as (the template loader should not accept that), the normalization will not properly happen, as FreeMarker (the cache) recognizes only the slashes as separators.
        ifSourceDiffersFrom - If we only want to load the template if its source differs from this. null if you want the template to be loaded unconditionally. If this is null then the ifVersionDiffersFrom parameter must be null too. See TemplateLoadingResult.getSource() for more about sources.
        ifVersionDiffersFrom - If we only want to load the template if its version (which is usually the last modification time) differs from this. null if ifSourceDiffersFrom is null, or if the backing storage from which the ifSourceDiffersFrom template source comes from doesn't store a version. See TemplateLoadingResult.getVersion() for more about versions.
        Returns:
        Not null.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • resetState

        public void resetState()
        Description copied from interface: TemplateLoader
        Invoked by Configuration.clearTemplateCache() to instruct this template loader to throw away its current state (some kind of cache usually) and start afresh. For most TemplateLoader implementations this does nothing.
        Specified by:
        resetState in interface TemplateLoader

      • getLastModified

        public static long getLastModified(URLConnection conn,
                                   boolean fallbackToJarLMD)
                            throws IOException
        URLConnection.getLastModified() with JDK bug workarounds. Because of JDK-6956385, for files inside a jar, it returns the last modification time of the jar itself, rather than the last modification time of the file inside the jar.
        Parameters:
        fallbackToJarLMD - Tells if the file is in side jar, then we should return the last modification time of the jar itself, or -1 (to work around JDK-6956385).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getURL

        protected abstract URL getURL(String name)
        Given a template name (plus potential locale decorations) retrieves an URL that points the template source.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the sought template (including the locale decorations, or other decorations the TemplateLookupStrategy uses).
        Returns:
        An URL that points to the template source, or null if it can be determined that the template source does not exist. For many implementations the existence of the template can't be decided at this point, and you rely on extractNegativeResult(URLConnection) instead.

      • extractNegativeResult

        protected abstract TemplateLoadingResult extractNegativeResult(URLConnection conn)
                                                        throws IOException
        Called before the resource if read, checks if we can immediately return a TemplateLoadingResult.NOT_FOUND or TemplateLoadingResult.NOT_MODIFIED, or throw an IOException. For example, for a HTTP-based storage, the HTTP response status 404 could result in TemplateLoadingResult.NOT_FOUND, 304 in TemplateLoadingResult.NOT_MODIFIED, and some others, like 500 in throwing an IOException.

        Some implementations rely on getURL(String) returning null when a template is missing, in which case this method is certainly not applicable.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • prepareConnection

        protected void prepareConnection(URLConnection conn)
        Called before anything that causes the connection to actually build up. This is where URLConnection.setIfModifiedSince(long) and such can be called if someone overrides this. The default implementation in URLTemplateLoader does nothing.

      • canonicalizePrefix

        protected static String canonicalizePrefix(String prefix)
        Can be used by subclasses to canonicalize URL path prefixes.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the path prefix to canonicalize
        Returns:
        the canonicalized prefix. All backslashes are replaced with forward slashes, and a trailing slash is appended if the original prefix wasn't empty and didn't already end with a slash.
